images.title: Sleep tight, little hedgehog
images.caption: Sleep tight, little hedgehog
images.desc: Though they may seem exotic to most people living on our shores, wild hedgehogs are quite common in much of the rest of the world. The tiny creatures are usually nocturnal and use their spiky exterior to protect themselves. Each hedgehog has about 6,000 quills, but the quills aren't poisonous and don't easily detach, like those of the also-quilled (but completely unrelated) porcupine.
